votes.question: On Passage of the Bill
votes.description: A bill to provide an extension of Federal-aid highway, highway safety, motor carrier safety, transit, and other programs funded out of the Highway Trust Fund, to provide resource flexibility to the Department of Veterans Affairs for health care services, and for other purposes.

votes.question: On Passage of the Bill
votes.description: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exempt employees with health coverage under TRICARE or the Veterans Administration from being taken into account for purposes of determining the employers to which the employer mandate applies under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act.

votes.question: On the Cloture Motion
votes.description: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exempt employees with health coverage under TRICARE or the Veterans Administration from being taken into account for purposes of determining the employers to which the employer mandate applies under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act.

votes.question: On the Amendment
votes.description: In the nature of a substitute.

votes.question: On the Cloture Motion
votes.description: In the nature of a substitute.

votes.question: On the Amendment
votes.description: To reauthorize and reform the Export-Import Bank of the United States.

votes.question: On the Motion for Attendance
votes.description: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exempt employees with health coverage under TRICARE or the Veterans Administration from being taken into account for purposes of determining the employers to which the employer mandate applies under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act.

votes.question: On the Cloture Motion
votes.description: To reauthorize and reform the Export-Import Bank of the United States.

votes.question: On the Cloture Motion
votes.description: To repeal the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act and the Health Care and Education Reconciliation Act of 2010 entirely.

votes.question: On the Motion to Proceed
votes.description: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exempt employees with health coverage under TRICARE or the Veterans Administration from being taken into account for purposes of determining the employers to which the employer mandate applies under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act.

votes.question: On Cloture on the Motion to Proceed
votes.description: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exempt employees with health coverage under TRICARE or the Veterans Administration from being taken into account for purposes of determining the employers to which the employer mandate applies under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act.
votes.result: Cloture on the Motion to Proceed Agreed to

votes.question: On Cloture on the Motion to Proceed
votes.description: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exempt employees with health coverage under TRICARE or the Veterans Administration from being taken into account for purposes of determining the employers to which the employer mandate applies under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act.
votes.result: Cloture on the Motion to Proceed Rejected

votes.question: On Passage of the Bill
votes.description: An original bill to reauthorize the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to ensure that every child achieves.

votes.question: On the Cloture Motion
votes.description: An original bill to reauthorize the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to ensure that every child achieves.

votes.question: On the Amendment
votes.description: To establish a Federal-State partnership to provide access to high-quality public prekindergarten programs from low-income and moderate-income families to ensure that they enter kindergarten prepared for success, and for other purposes.

votes.question: On the Amendment
votes.description: To amend title V of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to establish a full-service community schools grant program.

votes.question: On the Amendment
votes.description: To amend the allocation of funds under subpart 2 of part A of title I of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965.

votes.question: On the Amendment
votes.description: To authorize the establishment of American Dream Accounts.

votes.question: On the Amendment
votes.description: To provide for youth jobs, and for other purposes.

votes.question: On the Amendment
votes.description: To provide for State-determined assessment and accountability systems, and for other purposes.

votes.question: On the Amendment
votes.description: To amend the accountability provisions.

votes.question: On the Amendment
votes.description: To ensure that States measure and report on indicators of student access to critical educational resources and identify disparities in such resources, and for other purposes.

votes.question: On the Amendment
votes.description: To reinstate grants to improve the mental health of children.

votes.question: On the Amendment
votes.description: To establish a climate change education program.

votes.question: On the Cloture Motion
votes.description: In the nature of a substitute.

votes.question: On the Amendment
votes.description: To end discrimination based on actual or perceived sexual orientation or gender identity in public schools.

votes.question: On the Amendment
votes.description: To amend the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 relating to parental notification and opt-out of assessments.

votes.question: On the Amendment
votes.description: To require local educational agencies to inform parents of any State or local educational agency policy, procedure, or parental right regarding student participation in any mandated assessments for that school year.

votes.question: On the Amendment
votes.description: To require a State's report card to include information on the graduation rates of homeless children and children in foster care.

votes.question: On the Amendment
votes.description: To expand opportunity by allowing Title I funds to follow low-income children.

votes.question: On the Amendment
votes.description: To establish a committee on student privacy policy.

votes.question: On the Motion
votes.description: An act to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2016 for military activities of the Department of Defense, for military construction, and for defense activities of the Department of Energy, to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year, and for other purposes.

votes.question: On the Cloture Motion
votes.description: An act to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2016 for military activities of the Department of Defense, for military construction, and for defense activities of the Department of Energy, to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year, and for other purposes.

votes.question: On the Amendment
votes.description: To ensure that States have policies or procedures that prohibit aiding or abetting of sexual abuse, and for other purposes.

votes.question: On the Amendment
votes.description: To amend part A of title IV of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to allow funds provided under such part to be used for a site resource coordinator.

votes.question: On the Amendment
votes.description: To allow a State to submit a declaration of intent to the Secretary of Education to combine certain funds to improve the academic achievement of students.

votes.question: On the Amendment
votes.description: To allow States to let Federal funds for the education of disadvantaged children follow low-income children to the accredited or otherwise State-approved public school, private school, or supplemental educational services program they attend.

votes.question: On the Amendment
votes.description: To restore sections of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965.

votes.question: On the Amendment
votes.description: To amend section 1111(b)(2)(B)(xi) to provide for additional disaggregation for local educational agencies with a total of not less than 1,000 Asian and Native Hawaiian or Pacific Islander students.

votes.question: On the Amendment
votes.description: To amend the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 regarding school librarians and effective school library programs.

votes.question: On the Nomination
votes.description: Kara Farnandez Stoll, of Virginia, to be United States Circuit Judge for the Federal Circuit
